Patient: Cindy Kincaid
Date of Surgery: 2021-07-29
Primary Surgeon: Kelly
Surgical Assistants: Hills
Pre-operative Diagnosis: Adult Degenerative Scoliosis
Post-operative Diagnosis: Adult Degenerative Scoliosis
Indications: Low back pain and coronal imbalance, resistant to conservative measures.
Procedures Performed: Anterior: 1. Anterior diskectomy and fusion at L5-S1 2. Insertion of interbody biomechanical implant at L5-S1 (or application of structural allograft)
Posterior: 1. Posterior column osteotomy at L2-L3, L3-L4 and L4-L5 2. Decompression with bilateral partial laminectomies, foraminotomies, and medial facetectomies at L3-L4 3. Interbody fusion (without interbody implant) at L4-L5 4. Posterior spinal instrumentation at T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, L5 and S1 5. Instrumentation of the Pelvis with S2AI fixation 6. Posterior Spinal Fusion at T4-T5, T5-T6, T6-T7, T7-T8, T8-T9, T9-T10, T10-T11, T11-T12, T12-L1, L1-L2, L2-L3, L3-L4, L4-L5 and L5-S1 7. Application of Morselized Allograft, and Local Autograft 8. Spinal Cord Monitoring 9. Application of Cranial Tongs
Surgical Findings: none
Specimens Removed: none
Estimated Blood Loss: 900
Fluids/Transfusions: -pRBC's transfused: 2 units
Intraoperative Complications: none
Surgery Description: Anterior: The patient was brought to the operating room and after obtaining appropriate IV access, the patient underwent general anesthesia. Preoperative Antibiotics were administered including Cefazolin (Ancef) and Vancomycin. Spinal Cord Monitoring needles were inserted by the neurophysiology technologist. The patient was then positioned Supine on the OR table and all bony prominences were appropriately padded. After prepping and draping in the standard fashion, a surgical timeout was performed. The anterior approach to the spine was carried out with assistance from our vascular surgeon. A midline incision was made and the approach was carried out down toward the spine. Once the approach was complete, levels were confirmed using fluoroscopy.
I then proceeded with the diskectomy and interbody fusion of the L5-S1 interspace. First, I smoothed the anterior disk space and resected any osteophyte using a combination of a ronguer and burr. Using a combination of knife, currette, pituitary ronguer, and Kerrison rongeurs, the anterior longitudinal ligament was incised, the disc was excised and the superior and inferior endplates were lightly decorticated to prepare the endplates for fusion, taking care not to disrupt the cortical endplate. This completed the anterior diskectomy of L5-S1 interspace and partially completed the fusion of L5-S1.
I then proceeded with the insertion of the interbody implant into the L5-S1 interspace. I again confirmed that the endplates were adequately decorticated and appropriately level. Once I was fully satisfied with the preparation of the endplates, I used trials and measured the disk space to determine the appropriate size of the interbody implant. At the L5-S1 interspace, a 20mm height Allograft implant was selected. I then inserted the interbody implant into the disk space of L5-S1. The final position was confirmed using intraoperative xray. This completed the anterior interbody implant at L5-S1.
At the L5 level, I placed an anterior buttress plate. After selecting an appropriately sized plate and length for the screws, I held the plate into position and drilled and tapped the path for the screw. I then inserted the screw to secure the plate to the anterior vertebral body. The plate had adequate coverage of the intervertebral disc space.
The vascular surgery team then proceeded with closure of the wound. Vancomycin Powder was then placed into the surgical bed. The wound was then closed in a layered fashion. The subdermal layer was closed and subcutaneous suture was used to close the skin layer. Lastly, Prineo was applied to the surgical site.
At the conclusion of the case, all counts were correct. The drapes were removed and we prepared for the next portion of the procedure. I was personally present for the entirety of this portion of the case, including anterior diskectomy and fusion at L5-S1, insertion of interbody biomechanical implant at L5-S1, and the anterior spinal instrumentation (distinct from an interbody implant) at L5.
We then turned to the posterior portion of the case.
The patient was then positioned prone on the OR table and all bony prominences were appropriately padded. Cranial tongs applied to the patient's skull with an appropriate weight for cranial traction was used to position the head. The posterior spine was then prepped and draped in the standard fashion. A standard posterior approach to the spine was performed, exposing proximally to the T4 level and distally to the S1 level.
I then proceeded with the inferior facetectomies. The inferior, superior, medial and lateral borders of the inferior facet were identified. The inferior facets on the left and on the right at T4, on the left and on the right at T5, on the left and on the right at T6, on the left and on the right at T7, on the left and on the right at T8, on the left and on the right at T9, on the left and on the right at T10, on the left and on the right at T11, on the left and on the right at T12 and on the left and on the right at L1 were excised and the bone was morselized to be used as morselized autograft. This completed the inferior facetectomies of T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, and L1.
I then proceeded with the posterior column osteotomies. For the posterior column osteotomies, a small rent was made in the interlaminar space to develop the plane between the ligamentum and the dura. A Kerrison rongeur was then used to excise the ligamentum. this was carried out laterally in both directions until the facets were encountered. The superior and inferior facet were both adequately resected to fully release the posterior column. I performed posterior column (Smith-Peterson) osteotomies at L2-L3, L3-L4 and L4-L5 This completed the posterior column osteotomy of L2-L3, L3-L4, and L4-L5.
I then proceeded with the decompression with bilateral partial laminectomies, foraminotomies, and medial facetectomies. Using a combination of a high-speed burr and Kerrison rongeurs, I performed a partial laminectomy bilaterally at the L3-L4 interspace. First, I resected the dorsal lamina and then excised the ligamentum flavum, exposing the dura. To fully decompress the exiting and traversing nerve roots within the neural foramen and lateral recess, the medial facet was partially excised and a foraminotomy performed on the left and right at the L3-L4 interspace. Following the decompression, the canal and foramen were palpated to confirm an adequate decompression had been completed. This completed the decompression with bilateral partial laminectomies, foraminotomies, and medial facetectomies of L3-L4.
I then proceeded with the interbody fusion from the left side at the level of L4-L5. The inferior and superior facets of L4 and L5, respectively, were resected and the exiting and traversing nerve roots were appropriately protected. The annulus was incised, allowing access to the disk space. The disk was excised and endplates were prepped using a combination of currettes, shavers, and pituitary rongeurs. Once the endplates were adequately prepped, the size was confirmed and the interbody implant was placed into position along with allograft. The final position was confirmed using intraoperative xray. This completed the interbody fusion (without interbody implant) at the L4-L5 interspace.
I then proceeded with the posterior spinal instrumentation. For pedicle screws, the transverse process, pars, and superior facet were used as landmarks to identify the appropriate starting point. After identifying the start point, the superficial cortex was opened at each entry point using a high speed burr. A pedicle probe was then used to navigate down the pedicle, followed by palpating a medial, lateral, superior and inferior pedicle wall, measuring, and tapping if appropriate. At T4, a 6.5x40mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T5, a 6.5x40mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T6, a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T6, a 6.5x40mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T7, a 6.5x45mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a 6.5x45mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T8, a 6.5x45mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T8, a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T9, a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T9, a 6.5x45mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T10, a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T11, a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T12, a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T12, a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L1, a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At L1, a 6.5x60mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L2, a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At L2, a 6.5x60mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L3, a 6.5x60mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At L3, a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L4, a 6.5x50mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At L4, a 6.5x60mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L5, a 6.5x60mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a 6.5x60mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At S1, a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a 6.5x55mm polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. For pedicle hooks, a pedicle finder was carefully placed just under the inferior facet and above the superior facet, until the pedicle was found. Once the pedicle was identified, a pedicle hook was inserted directly toward the inferior pedicle, secured within the residual facet joint on the right at T4. This partially completed the posterior spinal instrumentation of T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, L5, and S1.
I then proceeded with instrumentation of the pelvis. For S2AI screw insertion, the starting point was identified at the inferior and lateral border of the S1 foramen. A probe was used to bore the path of the screw between the two cortices, across the sacroiliac joint, and aimed toward the anterior inferior iliac spine. Once the path was created, the walls of the path were palpated for breaches and the length of the path measured. Using this technique, an 8x80mm polyaxial S2AI screw was placed on the left and an 8x80mm polyaxial S2AI screw was placed on the right. This completed the instrumentation of the pelvis.
To complete the spinal instrumentation, a 5.5mm Cobalt Chrome rod was contoured for the left and a 5.5mm Titanium rod was contoured for the right and the rods placed into position and secured with set screws. The set screws were then tightened with a final tightener to the appropriate torque. Intraoperative Xray was used to confirm the final position of all implants. This completed the instrumentation of T4, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, L5, S1, and S2AI.
I then proceeded with the spinal fusion portion of the procedure. The posterior elements of T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, L5, and S1 were decorticated. To improve the odds of a successful fusion, 36mg of BMP was placed into the posterior fusion bed. A total of 300(cc) of Morselized allograft and Local Autograft was then impacted into the lateral gutters and into the facet joints. This completed the posterior spinal fusion procedure of T4-T5, T5-T6, T6-T7, T7-T8, T8-T9, T9-T10, T10-T11, T11-T12, T12-L1, L1-L2, L2-L3, L3-L4, L4-L5, and L5-S1.
I then proceeded with closure of the wound. Vancomycin Powder was then placed into the surgical bed. One drain was placed deep to the fascial layer. The wound was then closed in a layered fashion. The fascial layer was closed with a watertight closure. One drain was placed superficial to the fascial layer. The subdermal layer was closed and subcutaneous suture was used to close the skin layer. Lastly, Prineo was applied to the surgical site.
At the conclusion of the case, all counts were correct. The drapes were removed and the patient was turned uneventfully. I was personally present for the entirety of this portion of the case, including inferior facetectomies at T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12 and L1, posterior column osteotomy at L2-L3, L3-L4 and L4-L5, decompression with bilateral partial laminectomies, foraminotomies, and medial facetectomies at L3-L4, interbody fusion (without interbody implant) at L4-L5, posterior spinal instrumentation at T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, L5 and S1, pelvic instrumentation at S2AI, and the posterior spinal fusion at T4-T5, T5-T6, T6-T7, T7-T8, T8-T9, T9-T10, T10-T11, T11-T12, T12-L1, L1-L2, L2-L3, L3-L4, L4-L5 and L5-S1.
decompression with bilateral partial laminectomies, foraminotomies, and medial facetectomies
anterior spinal instrumentation (distinct from an interbody implant)
At the L5-S1 interspace, a 20mm height Allograft implant was selected.

Patient: Rebecca Collins
Date of Surgery: 2021-07-30
Primary Surgeon: Kelly
Surgical Assistants: Hills
Pre-operative Diagnosis: Idiopathic Scoliosis
Post-operative Diagnosis: Idiopathic Scoliosis
Indications: Coronal imbalance, resistant to conservative measures.
Procedures Performed: 1. Posterior spinal instrumentation at T2, T3, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, L1, L2, L3, L4 and L5 2. Posterior Spinal Fusion at T2-T3, T3-T4, T4-T5, T5-T6, T6-T7, T7-T8, T8-T9, T9-T10, T10-T11, T11-T12, T12-L1, L1-L2, L2-L3, L3-L4 and L4-L5 3. Application of Morselized Allograft 4. Spinal Cord Monitoring
Surgical Findings: none
Specimens Removed: none
Estimated Blood Loss: 500
Fluids/Transfusions: See Anesthesia Records
Intraoperative Complications: none
Surgery Description: The patient was brought to the operating room and after obtaining appropriate IV access, the patient underwent general anesthesia. Preoperative Antibiotics were administered including Cefazolin (Ancef) and Vancomycin . Spinal Cord Monitoring needles were inserted by the neurophysiology technologist. The proneview faceplate was used to pad and secure the patient's head and face during surgery. The patient was then positioned prone on the OR table and all bony prominences were appropriately padded. After prepping and draping in the standard fashion, a surgical timeout was performed. A standard posterior approach to the spine was performed, exposing proximally to the T2 level and distally to the L5 level.
I then proceeded with the inferior facetectomies. The inferior, superior, medial and lateral borders of the inferior facet were identified. The inferior facets on the left and on the right at T2, on the left and on the right at T3, on the left and on the right at T4, on the left and on the right at T5, on the left and on the right at T6, on the left and on the right at T7, on the left and on the right at T8, on the left and on the right at T9, on the left and on the right at T10, on the left and on the right at T11, on the left and on the right at T12, on the left and on the right at L1, on the left and on the right at L2, on the left and on the right at L3, on the left and on the right at L4 and on the left and on the right at L5 were excised and the bone was morselized to be used as morselized autograft. This completed the inferior facetectomies of T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, and L5.
I then proceeded with the posterior spinal instrumentation. For pedicle screws, the transverse process, pars, and superior facet were used as landmarks to identify the appropriate starting point. After identifying the start point, the superficial cortex was opened at each entry point using a high speed burr. A pedicle probe was then used to navigate down the pedicle, followed by palpating a medial, lateral, superior and inferior pedicle wall, measuring, and tapping if appropriate. At T2, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T3, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T5, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T6, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T7, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T8, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T9, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At T10, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At T11, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L1, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L2, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left. At L3, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L4, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. At L5, a polyaxial screw was inserted on the left and a polyaxial screw was inserted on the right. For pedicle hooks, a pedicle finder was carefully placed just under the inferior facet and above the superior facet, until the pedicle was found. Once the pedicle was identified, a pedicle hook was inserted directly toward the inferior pedicle, secured within the residual facet joint on the right at T2 and on the right at T3. This partially completed the posterior spinal instrumentation of T2, T3, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, L1, L2, L3, L4, and L5.
To complete the spinal instrumentation, a 5.5mm Cobalt Chrome rod was contoured for the left and a 5.5mm Titanium rod was contoured for the right and the rods placed into position and secured with set screws. The set screws were then tightened with a final tightener to the appropriate torque. Intraoperative Xray was used to confirm the final position of all implants. This completed the instrumentation of T2, T2, T3, T3, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, L1, L2, L3, L4, and L5.
I then proceeded with the spinal fusion portion of the procedure. The posterior elements of T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4, and L5 were decorticated. A total of 150(cc) of Morselized allograft was then impacted into the lateral gutters and into the facet joints. This completed the posterior spinal fusion procedure of T2-T3, T3-T4, T4-T5, T5-T6, T6-T7, T7-T8, T8-T9, T9-T10, T10-T11, T11-T12, T12-L1, L1-L2, L2-L3, L3-L4, and L4-L5.
I then proceeded with closure of the wound. Vancomycin Powder was then placed into the surgical bed. One drain was placed deep to the fascial layer. The wound was then closed in a layered fashion. The fascial layer was closed with a watertight closure. One drain was placed superficial to the fascial layer. The subdermal layer was closed and subcutaneous suture was used to close the skin layer. Lastly, Dermabond, and a water tight dressing was applied to the surgical site.
At the conclusion of the case, all counts were correct. The drapes were removed and the patient was turned onto the hospital bed, and awoke uneventfully. I was personally present for the entirety of the case, including inferior facetectomies at T2, T3, T4, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, T12, L1, L2, L3, L4 and L5, posterior spinal instrumentation at T2, T3, T5, T6, T7, T8, T9, T10, T11, L1, L2, L3, L4 and L5, and the posterior spinal fusion at T2-T3, T3-T4, T4-T5, T5-T6, T6-T7, T7-T8, T8-T9, T9-T10, T10-T11, T11-T12, T12-L1, L1-L2, L2-L3, L3-L4 and L4-L5.
myelopathy: nurick 5 (depended on assistive device for ambulating)

Patient: William Hopper
Date of Surgery: 2021-07-30
Primary Surgeon: Hills
Surgical Assistants: Dial
Pre-operative Diagnosis: Spinal Stenosis and Myelopathy
Post-operative Diagnosis: Spinal Stenosis and Myelopathy
Indications: Myelopathy: nurick 5 (depended on assistive device for ambulating), resistant to conservative measures.
Procedures Performed: 1. Decompression with central laminectomy at C3 2. Laminoplasty at C4, C5 and C6 3. Spinal Cord Monitoring 4. Application of Cranial Tongs
Surgical Findings: none
Specimens Removed: none
Estimated Blood Loss: 150
Fluids/Transfusions: -Crystalloids: 1500cc
Intraoperative Complications: none
Surgery Description: The patient was brought to the operating room and after obtaining appropriate IV access, the patient underwent general anesthesia. Preoperative Antibiotics were administered including Cefazolin (Ancef) and Vancomycin . Spinal Cord Monitoring needles were inserted by the neurophysiology technologist. Cranial tongs were applied to the patient's skull for positioning and an appropriate weight was selected for cranial traction. The patient was then positioned prone on the OR table and all bony prominences were appropriately padded. After prepping and draping in the standard fashion, a surgical timeout was performed. A standard posterior approach to the spine was performed, exposing proximally to the C3 level and distally to the C6 level.
I then proceeded with the decompression with central laminectomy. Using the cranial and caudal edges of the lamina and pars as landmarks, I performed a laminectomy at C3. First, using a combination of a high-speed burr and Kerrison rongeurs, I resected the dorsal lamina. I then excised the underlying ligamentum flavum. Following the decompression, the canal was palpated to confirm an adequate decompression had been completed. This completed the decompression with central laminectomy of C3.
I then proceeded with the laminoplasty. For laminoplasty, an opening and hinge trough was created with a high-speed burr angled perpendicular to the lamina at the lateral mass-lamina junction. This was performed at C4, C5 and C6. After all troughs were completed, greenstick fractures were created to open the lamina at the laminoplasty levels, the ligamentum flavum at the proximal and distal levels was excised, and laminoplasty plates were sequentially secured into place. The spinous processes were trimmed and the canal was palpated to confirm an adequate decompression had been completed. This completed the laminoplasty of C4, C5, and C6.
I then proceeded with closure of the wound. Vancomycin Powder was then placed into the surgical bed. One drain was placed deep to the fascial layer. The wound was then closed in a layered fashion. The fascial layer was closed with a watertight closure. One drain was placed superficial to the fascial layer. The subdermal layer was closed and subcutaneous suture was used to close the skin layer. Lastly, Steristrips, Dermabond, and a water tight dressing was applied to the surgical site.
At the conclusion of the case, all counts were correct. The drapes were removed and the patient was turned onto the hospital bed, and awoke uneventfully. I was personally present for the entirety of the case, including decompression with central laminectomy at C3, and the laminoplasty at C4, C5 and C6.
